channel.title: Arts
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: What’s on TV Sunday: Campaign Trails on ‘60 Minutes’ and ‘The Circus’
item.description: “60 Minutes” and “The Circus” parse the final days of the presidential campaign. And Nick Nolte plays a former president on the wrong side of history in “Graves.”
item.author: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK

item.title: Beyoncé’s True Political Statement This Week? It Wasn’t at a Clinton Rally
item.description: The pop star’s appearance with the Dixie Chicks at the Country Music Association Awards was powerful — and sly.
item.author: By WESLEY MORRIS

item.title: Gentrification Protesters in Los Angeles Target Art Galleries
item.description: Spray paint and hurled bottles draw the notice of the police as a neighborhood’s Mexican-American residents fear being displaced.
item.author: By JENNIFER MEDINA

item.title: What’s on TV Saturday: Benedict Cumberbatch Hosts ‘Saturday Night Live’
item.description: Benedict Cumberbatch, in theaters as “Doctor Strange,” hosts “S.N.L.” And Alex Gibney investigates the potential for cyberwarfare in “Zero Days.”
item.author: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK

item.title: Dancing Back the Spirit of an Old Friend
item.description: John Bernd was the inspiration for a series exploring the impact of the AIDS epidemic on dance.
item.author: By SIOBHAN BURKE

item.title: Richard Steiner, Producer of Broadway Hits, Dies at 69
item.description: Mr. Steiner worked a broad variety of jobs and was, among other things, a poker champion.
item.author: By WILLIAM GRIMES

item.title: Liam Scarlett Named to Queensland Ballet Post
item.description: Li Cunxin, the artistic director of the Australian company, said Mr. Scarlett would create new works for the ballet and stage some of his existing pieces, including “No Man’s Land.”
item.author: By ROSLYN SULCAS

item.title: Review: From Balanchine to Jookin, a Sampler of Summer Souvenirs
item.description: “Vail Dance Festival: ReMix NYC” features ballet rarities and premieres, including Alexei Ratmansky’s “Fandango,” as well as collaborations like Lil Buck and Yo-Yo Ma.
item.author: By ALASTAIR MACAULAY

item.title: Kobe Bryant’s Next Step, New Shoes and Moves With Los Angeles Artists
item.description: Mr. Bryant, who retired from basketball, has entered several other ventures.
item.author: By ADAM POPESCU

item.title: SundanceTV’s Identity Crisis: Indie by Night. Innocent by Day.
item.description: This channel’s new daytime block includes “All in the Family” and “The Mary Tyler Moore Show.” Good shows, but they don’t quite scream, “independent film.”
item.author: By NEIL GENZLINGER
